content: Search Free Trial Get Demo DATA443 EXECUTES LETTER OF INTENT WITH LEADING SERVICE DESK SOFTWARE PROVIDER WITH OVER 1,000,000 ACTIVE USERS March 31, 2020 Over 100,000 installations distributed by Tucows and Download.com Leading Privacy, Classification, Archiving  DRM platforms to be offered to new client base Leverages Data443s recent private cloud hosted facility investment Expected to positively influence revenue growth for 2020 RALEIGH, N.C., March 31, 2020  Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. ,  OTCPK ATDS , a leading data security and privacy software company, today announced the first of many planned deals to bolster its product and customer portfolio in 2020. A letter of intent to acquire the assets and customer base of Internet Software Sciences of Los Altos Hills, CA was executed today. Internet Software Sciences ISS, founded in 1995, is an innovator of asset management capabilities for IT help desk operations and customer support organizations. ISS has over 100,000 installations with over 1 million end users worldwide from corporations, educational institutions, non-profits and government agencies. Even operating in these extremely challenging conditions, we continue to execute on our business model, service our customer base and deliver on our commitments to our clients and shareholders. This transaction is yet another example of this. To date none of our customers have canceled any of our services due to COVID-19 or market conditions  reinforcing the resiliency of our multiple product stack and importance of data security and compliance requirements., stated Mr. Jason Remillard, Founder, CEO and President of Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. Crossing over 1,000,000 active end users  this is fertile ground for Data443 to market and sell its privacy stack. Market capture is critical for this new privacy compliance space, and this deal will strengthen our position as the leading technology and capability provider for data privacy and compliance services. Competing directly with the likes of ServiceNow, Atlassian ServiceDesk and Zendesk, ISSs WebCenter , an open source suite of six web-based IT help desk, Sales CRM, and customer support applications, has been distributed by leading platforms such as Download.com and Tucows.com with over 100,000 downloads servicing millions of end users for over 2 decades. We were looking for a growing and fast paced home for our massive client base that has grown and developed over 20 years  one that they can trust and have more products to use., stated Founder and President of Internet Software Sciences, Mr. Scott Vanderlip. Its important that our clients have a leader in open source capabilities and a path towards professional support and additional product consumption options. Data privacy and security capabilities is a top priority for our customers  who are very technically focused in their day to day jobs. Hosted and hybrid cloud security capabilities are key functionalities that they have been requesting for quite some time. The deal follows the recent rollout of Data443s newest product, Global Privacy Manager , product which is built on the award winning data classification platform ClassiDocs and Data443s WordPress GDPR Framework , the worlds largest deployed GDPR platform  currently powering more than 30,000 businesses worldwide for the EUs GDPR Privacy Law. The combined platform automatically searches the data residing in cloud application, databases, servers, and endpoints used by businesses to discover, classify and map customer data. We look forward to closing this transaction in the near-term, onboard the product and customer base into our existing sales, support and marketing infrastructure which leverages our newly built private hybrid cloud facility in the Raleigh-Durham area. Importantly, once closed, this transaction is expected to be positively accretive for Data443 concluded Mr. Remillard. Final details of the transaction were not disclosed. About Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. OTCPK ATDS, is an industry leader in the data security and privacy business, providing software and services to enable secure data across local devices, network, cloud, and databases, at rest and in flight. Its suite of products and services is highlighted by i ARALOC, which is a market leading secure, cloud-based platform for the management, protection and distribution of digital content to the desktop and mobile devices, which protects an organizations confidential content and intellectual property assets from leakage  malicious or accidental  without impacting collaboration between all stakeholders ii ArcMail, which is a leading provider of simple, secure and cost-effective email and enterprise archiving and management solutions iii ClassiDocs, the Companys award-winning data classification and governance technology, which supports CCPA, LGPD and GDPR compliance iv ClassiDocs for Blockchain, which provides an active implementation for the Ripple XRP that protects blockchain transactions from inadvertent disclosure and data leaks v Data443 Global Privacy Manager, the privacy compliance and consumer loss mitigation platform which is integrated with ClassiDocs to do the delivery portions of GDPR and CCPA as well as process Data Privacy Access Requests  removal request  with inventory by ClassiDocs vi Data443 Protect, which provides nearly instant Cloud-deployed Data Loss Prevention capabilities with false positive rates unmatched enabled by ClassiDocs vii Data443 Virtual Data Protection Officer program that offers a turnkey and outsourced DPO capability for smaller organizations viii DATAEXPRESS, the leading Data transport, transformation and delivery product trusted by leading financial organizations worldwide ix the WordPress GDPR Framework with over 30,000 active users enables organizations of all sizes to comply with the GDPR and other privacy frameworks.    - **Data443 Protect**: Cloud-deployed Data Loss Prevention (DLP) solution with low false positive rates, enabling organizations to protect sensitive data effectively.

   Benefits to users include enhanced data security, compliance with global privacy regulations, and tools to manage and protect sensitive information.

   - While specific compliance certifications (e.g., ISO 27001) are not explicitly mentioned in the content, the focus on regulatory adherence suggests a commitment to industry standards.  

3. **User-Focused Security Recommendations**  
   - **Regular Data Classification**: Use ClassiDocs to classify and govern data effectively, ensuring compliance with privacy regulations.  
   - **Enable DLP**: Deploy Data443 Protect to monitor and prevent unauthorized data leaks.  
   - **Leverage Privacy Tools**: Utilize the Global Privacy Manager to handle data privacy access requests and ensure compliance with GDPR and CCPA.  
   - **Secure Content Distribution**: Use ARALOC to protect intellectual property and confidential content during collaboration.  
   - **Auditing and Monitoring**: Regularly audit data flows and user activities to identify and mitigate potential security risks.  

4. **Technical Security Implementation Details**  
   - **Hybrid Cloud Security**: Data443's private cloud-hosted facility supports hybrid cloud deployments, ensuring secure data management across cloud and on-premises environments.  
   - **Data Transport and Transformation**: The DATAEXPRESS product enables secure and efficient data transport and transformation, trusted by financial organizations.  
   - **Integration Capabilities**: Data443's products are designed to integrate with existing systems, such as IT help desks and customer support applications, to provide a seamless security experience.  
   - **Scalability**: With over 1,000,000 active users, Data443's platforms are built to scale, supporting large and distributed organizations.  

5. **Data Protection Measures**  
   - **Encryption**: ARALOC and other products likely use encryption to protect data at rest and in transit.  
   - **Access Control**: Role-based access controls ensure that only authorized users can access sensitive data.  
   - **Data Loss Prevention (DLP)**: Data443 Protect is designed to identify and block unauthorized data transfers.  
   - **Secure Content Distribution**: ARALOC ensures that confidential content is shared securely without risking unauthorized leaks.  

6. **Best Practices for End Users**

   - **Regular Updates**: Keep all software and systems updated to protect against vulnerabilities.  
   - **Strong Password Policies**: Enforce multi-factor authentication and strong password policies to secure access to Data443 platforms.  
   - **Backup and Recovery**: Regularly back up critical data and ensure recovery processes are in place to mitigate potential data loss.  

**Summary**  
Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. provides a robust suite of security and privacy solutions designed to protect sensitive data and ensure compliance with global regulations. The company's products offer advanced features such as data classification, DLP, and secure content distribution, making it a strong choice for organizations looking to enhance their data security posture. By following the user-focused recommendations and best practices outlined above, organizations can maximize the benefits of Data443's solutions and safeguard their data effectively.

analyses.user_guidance:
### **Data Security and Protection Guidance**

As a security advisor, I have outlined practical, easy-to-follow recommendations to help users protect their data, maintain privacy, and stay secure online. These guidelines are designed to be actionable and applicable to both individuals and organizations.

---

### **1. Security Best Practices**

- **Use Strong, Unique Passwords**: Avoid using the same password across multiple platforms. Use a password manager to securely store and generate complex passwords.
- **Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: Add an extra layer of security by requiring a second form of verification (e.g., a code sent to your phone or biometric authentication) when logging in to accounts.
- **Keep Software Updated**: Regularly update your operating system, applications, and browser plugins to protect against vulnerabilities.
- **Encrypt Sensitive Data**: Use encryption for sensitive files or communications, especially when transmitting data over public Wi-Fi or unsecured networks.
- **Be Cautious with Email Attachments and Links**: Avoid opening suspicious emails, attachments, or clicking on links from unknown sources. These could be phishing attempts or malware.

---

### **2. Data Protection Recommendations**

- **Backup Your Data**: Regularly back up important files to an external drive or a secure cloud storage service.
- **Use Data Classification Tools**: Tools like Data443’s ClassiDocs can help classify and protect sensitive data, ensuring compliance with regulations like GDPR or CCPA.
- **Secure Cloud Storage**: Use reputable cloud services with built-in encryption and access controls.
- **Implement Access Controls**: Restrict access to sensitive data to only those who need it. Use role-based permissions to limit exposure.
- **Monitor for Leaks**: Use data loss prevention (DLP) tools to detect and prevent unauthorized data sharing.

---

### **3. Safe Usage Guidelines**

- **Use Secure Communication Channels**: For sensitive conversations, use encrypted messaging apps like Signal or WhatsApp instead of plain text messaging.
- **Avoid Public Wi-Fi for Sensitive Tasks**: Public Wi-Fi networks are often unsecured. Avoid accessing financial accounts or sensitive data while connected to public Wi-Fi.
- **Disable Unnecessary Features**: Turn off location services, Bluetooth, and other features when not needed to reduce the risk of unauthorized access.
- **Stay Informed**: Keep up with the latest cybersecurity threats and best practices to stay ahead of attackers.

---

### **4. Common Security Risks and Prevention**

- **Insider Threats**: Monitor user activity and ensure employees understand data security policies to reduce the risk of accidental or intentional leaks.
- **Phishing Attacks**: Train users to identify phishing emails by looking for typos, generic greetings, and urgent requests for sensitive information.
- **Ransomware**: Regularly back up data and ensure antivirus software is up to date to protect against ransomware attacks.
- **Data Breaches**: Use encryption and DLP tools to minimize the impact of a breach. Consider using a Virtual Data Protection Officer (VPO) service for oversight.

---

### **5. Privacy Protection Measures**

- **Understand Data Regulations**: Familiarize yourself with privacy laws like GDPR, CCPA, or HIPAA to ensure compliance when handling personal data.
- **Minimize Data Collection**: Only collect and store data that is necessary for your operations to reduce the risk of unauthorized exposure.
- **Protect Personal Identifiable Information (PII)**: Use tools like Data443’s Global Privacy Manager to manage and protect PII.
- **Regularly Review Permissions**: Check which apps and services have access to your data and revoke unnecessary permissions.

---

### **6. When to Seek Additional Security Support**

- **If You Handle Sensitive Data**: If your organization works with financial, healthcare, or personal data, consider consulting a professional security team to ensure compliance and protection.
- **After a Security Incident**: If you suspect a breach or have been targeted by malware, contact a cybersecurity expert immediately to contain and resolve the issue.
- **During Major IT Changes**: When adopting new technologies or migrating to the cloud, seek guidance to ensure proper security measures are in place.
- **For Compliance Requirements**: If your organization must meet specific regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), consult with a security expert to ensure compliance.

---

By following these guidelines, users can significantly reduce their risk of data breaches, improve privacy, and stay protected in an evolving digital landscape. For additional support, consider leveraging tools and services from trusted providers like Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc.
